malware.notes: likely cause was a malware infection of a type that typically scans for login and password information

asset.notes: compromised server was disconnected from internetFollowing enumerations present before veris 1.3.3 removed: asset.governance.Unknown.

confidentiality.notes: The affected server contained patient treatment and billing information, in addition to our encrypted electronic medical record data with information such as name, date of birth, address, social security number, and health/diagnosis information.

discovery_notes: upon discovering a server malfunction, CCBT immediately secured the server by disconnecting it from the Internet, changed all workstation and vendor passwords, and added additional IT security safeguards; later found malware
notes: CCBT's server was accessed by unauthorized users. The affected server contained patient treatment and billing information, in addition to encrypted electronic medical record data; likely cause was a malware infection of a type that typically scans for login and password information and first unauthorized access was on November 19, 2015.
summary: Complete Chiropractic & Bodywork Therapies notified 4,082 patients after discovering malware
